intro: Eugenia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, round berry that changes color from green to red as it matures.
